CatDescriptText: Miss Ida Mae French, alderman's clerk, 1511 Centre Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think those receiving Mother's Assistance should be required to report to the proper authorities just how all of the grant is spent, or should the present latitude in spending it be permitted to continue?" answer reads: "Yes, I think so. After all, since we are subsidizing, it is nice to know just where the money is going."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ida Mae French wearing trench coat, standing on Liberty Avenue with Jenkins Arcade in background, Downtown
